QuasiTiler 3.0

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Eugenio Durand
ARTICLE.COMMENT: This is a short description of an algorithm generating Penrose tillings. An online demo is available to play with.

X.T: Numerical Recipes in C

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: William H. Press
Saul A. Teukolsky
William T. Vetterling
Brian P. Flannery
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The very well known book is available online.

X.T: Graph structure in the web

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Andrei Broder
Ravi Kumar
Farzin Maghoul
Prabhakar Raghavan
Sridhar Rajagopalan
Raymie Stata
Andrew Tomkins
Janet Wiener
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Studying the Web topology with graph theories: the Web is a bowtie.

X.T: The physics of the Web

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Albert-László Barabási
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A further Web analysis: the Web appears to be a network ruled by a power-law distribution.

X.T: Le nombre Pi

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Jean Brette
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some very basic information about π and the computation Archimedes has done to evaluate it.

X.T: Graph Identification and Privacy in Social Networks

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Lise Getoor
ARTICLE.COMMENT: After a high level description on algorithms used to identify several different (because of the data noise) nodes as referring the same entity, Lise Getoor speaks about how to use these algorithms in social network in order to infer private information.

X.T: The Church-Turing Thesis: Story and Recent Progress

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Yuri Gurevich
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The premises of Church-Turing thesis, the thesis itself and the current work on it (abstract state machines).

X.T: The Marriage of Fractals and Splines

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Ron Goldman
ARTICLE.COMMENT: After looking to analogies between fractals and Bézier curves, Ron Golgman explains how to combine them by using complex numbers in Bézier equations.

X.T: Fast Route Planning

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Peter Sanders
ARTICLE.COMMENT: After a quick presentation of the algorithm, Peter Sanders presents some current uses and some possible future improvements to more complex problems.

X.T: Learning Low Dimensional Manifolds

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Yoav Freund
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Yoav Freund presents the random projection trees algorithm used to extract the few intrinsic dimensions in a highly-constrained high-dimensional system.

X.T: Learning From Examples Using Quantum Annealing (Google Workshop on Quantum Biology)

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Hartmut Neven
ARTICLE.COMMENT: This talk spends more time on explaining that machine learning from samples is an optimization issue, than describing how the algorithm is implemented on D-Wave chip.

X.T: Graphs with Chris Dixon

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Chris Dixon
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Trying to predict someone's tastes in a domain from the preferences of other persons having taste similarities in other domains.

X.T: Near-Optimal Parallel Join Processing in MapReduce

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Mirek Riedewald
ARTICLE.COMMENT:
A very technical presentation of an algorithm to implement join models in a MapReduce framework (see also this paperhttp://www.ccs.neu.edu/home/mirek/papers/2011-SIGMOD-ParallelJoins.pdf
frPDF).

X.T: Turing Centennial Conference: Turing, Church, Gödel, Computability, Complexity and Randomization

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Michael Rabin
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The history of computer theory, unsolvability, complexity... by one mathematician who participated to it.

X.T: Demain : quel temps ? Un mathématicien en visite chez Chronos

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Jean-Marc Deshouillers
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The presentation of some subjects more or less linked to time, but their presentation is very high level so you have to know about them beforehand and, and the connection between the subjects is unclear.

X.T: La symétrie ici et là

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Henri Bacry
ARTICLE.COMMENT: It is a pity that, given the speaker, the level of the presentation is so low and the last part, which gets philosophical, could have been more interesting if it would have been better presented.

X.T: Des particules, des étoiles et des probabilités

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Cédric Villani
ARTICLE.COMMENT: From the study of system solar stability to a proof of Landau damping.

X.T: Dobble et la géométrie finie

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Maxime Bourrigan
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A mathematical analysis of Dobble.

X.T: Poincaré, membre du Bureau des Longitudes, et la géodésie (1893-1912)

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Martina Schiavon
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A description of what was the Bureau des Longitudes, the participation of Poincaré, and the measurement of Quito meridian.

X.T: La conjecture de Syracuse

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A presentation of Collatz conjecture.

X.T: Yitang Zhang Proves 'Landmark' Theorem in Distribution of Prime Numbers -- Unheralded Mathematician Bridges the Prime Gap

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Erica Klarreich
ARTICLE.COMMENT: An unknown mathematician proves that there is an infinity of pairs of primes such as their difference is smaller than 70,000,000.

BLIST.TITLE:
rational trigonometry:
This is bullshit.
Wildberger claims to have invented a new way to handle trigonometry, but this is just a rather simple rewrite of things known for a long time.
This may amuse a teenager interested by playing with mathematics.

X.T: WildTrig0: An Invitation to Geometry: the WildTrig series

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Norman J. Wildberger
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The introduction of the series and some advertisement for his book. He explains that some reasoning can be wrong because based on what we see on a drawing. He does such reasoning in the following videos...

X.T: WildTrig1: Why Trig is Hard

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Norman J. Wildberger
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A reminder of the trigonometry as it is commonly taught.

X.T: WildTrig2: Quadrance via Pythagoras and Archimedes

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Norman J. Wildberger
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The presentation of quadrance, Pythagoras' theorem, and triple quad formula.

X.T: WildTrig3: Spread, angles and astronomy

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Norman J. Wildberger
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The presentation of spread.

X.T: WildTrig4: Five main laws of rational trigonometry

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Norman J. Wildberger
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The demonstration of three new formulas: the spread law, the cross law, and the triple spread formula.

X.T: Le Manuscrit Einstein-Besso

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Etienne Klein
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Etienne Klein quickly summarizes Einstein's work and answers to some questions on the current status of physics.

X.T: A Practical T-Ray Amplifier -- Terahertz radiation lets security screeners find bombs and weapons wherever they're hidden

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Saswato R. Das
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some progress in terahertz radiation (aka "T-rays") sensors.

X.T: Emmy Noether and The Fabric of Reality

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Ransom Stephens
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A presentation of Emmy Noether's life and theorem ("If a system has a continuous symmetry property, then there are corresponding quantities whose values are conserved in time.").

X.T: The Origin of the Universe and the Arrow of Time

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Sean Carroll
ARTICLE.COMMENT: After reminding the second law of thermodynamics, Sean Carroll presents his multiverse theory.

X.T: Les Battements du temps - Marc Lachièze-Rey & Jean Claude Ameisen

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Marc Lachièze-Rey
Jean Claude Ameisen
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A description of what time and causality are in the Newtonian theory and in the theory of relativity.

X.T: L'antimatière existe : je l'ai rencontrée

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Catherine Thibault
ARTICLE.COMMENT: What is antimatter? How it has been discover? Dissymmetry with matter...

X.T: Why Physicists Need the Large Hadron Collider

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Edward Farhi
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Edward Farhi does not really talk about the LHC, this discussion is more about particle physics in general.

X.T: Richard Dawkins: An atheist's call to arms
Richard Dawkins: The universe is queerer than we can suppose

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Richard Dawkins
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Things such as quantum physics seem strange to us because our brain is good at what is useful for monkey's life and atom nucleuses are not part of this life.

X.T: Leonard Susskind: My friend Richard Feynman
Leonard Susskind: My friend Richard Feynman

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Leonard Susskind
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Susskind tells stories about his friend Feynman.

X.T: Physics shocker! Neutrinos clocked faster than light

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Stephen Shankland
ARTICLE.COMMENT: During the OPERA experiment, researchers computed a speed of neutrinos greater than the speed of light.

X.T: Is the Higgs Boson there? Why do we care?

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Edward Farhi
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A casual talk on LHC and particles, Edward Farhi does give more information than in his other talks.

X.T: John Preskill: Quantum Computing and the Entanglement Frontier

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: John Preskill
ARTICLE.COMMENT: How to build a quantum computer and how to deal with quantum entanglement.

X.T: Quand les trous noirs éclairent la théorie d'Einstein

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Pierre Binétruy
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some basic information about black holes, relativity, and the LISA (Laser Interferometry Space Antenna) project.

X.T: Morphogénèses chimiques : les réactions créatrices de rythmes et de formes

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Patrick De Kepper
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A presentation of chemical reactions generating temporal and/or spatial structures.

X.T: Apollo XI : résumé couleur de la mission sur la Lune

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A summary of the Apollo XI mission.

X.T: Our Place in the Cosmos

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Raja (Puragra) GuhaThakurta
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The explained physics is very basic, but the pictures and videos are interesting.

X.T: The Remote Agent Experiment: Debugging Code from 60 Million Miles Away

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Ron Garret
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A description of the RAX project and some opinion about the evolution of NASA.

X.T: The Second Copernican Revolution: Our Changing View of Our Place in the Universe

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: John L. Callas
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Life could be somewhere else in the universe: hundred of exoplanets have been found; Enceladus and Europa contains liquid water; Mars exploration proves that the planet had some liquid water.

X.T: Mars Exploration Driven by Curiosity

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Michael A. Meyer
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A description of the Mars rover, its arrival on Mars, its route on the planet, and its first discoveries.

X.T: Matt Deans, NASA: The Exploration Ground Data System (xGDS)

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Matt Deans
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A description of the software tools used for mapping, planning the road and experiments of a robot, logging notes from the scientists...

X.T: Orbital Debris: Time to Remove

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Eugene Levin
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The problem of the orbital debris and a proposed solution to solve it.

X.T: Voyager 1 Discovers Bizarre and Baffling Region at Edge of Solar System

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Adam Mann
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The measurements sent by Voyager 1, as it is leaving the solar system, are unexpected.

X.T: U.S. Nuclear Accidents

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Allen H. Lutins
ARTICLE.COMMENT: This is a list of the nuclear accidents in the US.

X.T: Inside Three Mile Island: Minute By Minute

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Scott Johnson
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The narration of the Match 28, 1979 accident. This is a good factual paper, maybe slightly sensationalistic. The consequences of the accident are not tackled.

X.T: Three Mile Island 2 Accident

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: NRC
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A fact sheet on the accident: description, health effects and ensuing decisions.

X.T: The NRX Incident

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Peter Jedicke
ARTICLE.COMMENT: This is a presentation of the partial meltdown of an experimental nuclear reactor in Canada (1952).

X.T: Chernobyl - Ten Years on Radiological and Health Impact
Chernobyl - Ten Years on Radiological and Health Impact

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: NEA Committee on Radiation Protection and Public Health
ARTICLE.COMMENT: This report summarizes the accident events, its impacts on health and environment and the lessons learned.

X.T: Chelyabinsk - The Most Contaminated Spot on the Planet

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Log In Productions
ARTICLE.COMMENT: These pages contains the materials of a film about the Chelyabinsk region.

X.T: Ozersk

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Nils Boehmer
Thomas Nilsen
ARTICLE.COMMENT: This is another article on Chelyabinsk. This one is more technical and speaks less about the human impact than the previous one.

X.T: Arctic Sea Dumping

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Hilde Elin Haaland
Chad Cummins
Shehu Ibrahim
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A summary of the USSR dumping of military nuclear waste and their potential impact on Norway.

X.T: Tokaimura (Japan's Sep. 30, 1999) Nuclear Accident: It's Causes, Health & Environmental Effects

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Najmedin Meshkati
ARTICLE.COMMENT: This student work gives some information about JCO's accident.

X.T: Case Study: Sverdlovsk Anthrax Outbreak of 1979

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Alex Neifert
ARTICLE.COMMENT: An anthrax epidemic in USSR: infected meat or a leakage from a military laboratory?

X.T: Where Have the Birds of Guam Gone?

ARTICLE.COMMENT: An overview of the brown tree snake invasion on Guam and how these snake are destroying the local life.

X.T: Curing Guam's Snake Epidemic

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Tim Stoddard
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A more detailed description of the Guam disaster: most aspects (attacks of babies, economy impact, virus introduction...) are described.

X.T: Lake Victoria

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Marcela Rabi
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A very good overview of the Lake Victoria issues (perch invasion and eutrophication) and all the impacts on animals, humans and economy.

X.T: Craig Venter's Epic Voyage to Redefine the Origin of the Species

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: James Shreeve
ARTICLE.COMMENT: After having decoded the human genome, Venter is now capturing genes of microbes around the world.

X.T: What on earth? Database to list all named species

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Colin Nickerson
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Encyclopedia of Life: a tentative to build a database of all species.

X.T: Billion Bag, Bottle, and Bulb Challenge

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Greg Peterson
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Nothing new here, maybe because, in Europe, we are more concerned by preserving the environment and we already know all this stuff.

X.T: The World Market for Coal: What's going on the C of "RE less than C"?

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: David Victor
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some information on the coal market and the fact that Carbon Capture and Storage efforts are much lower than required.

X.T: Making a Difference: Individuals Taking Local Action on Global Warming

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Julio Magalhães
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A description of the initiatives of the Silicon Valley's Sierra Club Chapter to help reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

X.T: The Liquid Fluoride Thorium Reactor: What Fusion Wanted To Be

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Joe Bonometti
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A description of a reactor design using thorium. Joe Bonometti explains its advantages compared to the current nuclear plant technologies: simpler, safer, more fuel reserves, faster decay of waste...

X.T: THE THORIUM PROBLEM - Danger of existing thorium regulation to U.S. manufacturing and energy sector

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: John Kutsch
Jim Kennedy
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A badly edited video from a proponent of liquid fluoride thorium reactor.

X.T: Novacarb. Le virage vert

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Colin Nickerson
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The green efforts of Novacarb.

X.T: Jordan's Radioactive Water Problem -- A critical $1 billion engineering project in Jordan could be complicated by radium

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Sandra Upson
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Jordan has decided to use "fossil" water instead of desalinated seawater, but this one is contaminated with radium.

X.T: Map: China Rewires Its Rivers -- A massive water diversion project aims to slake the north's thirst

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Anne-Marie Corley
ARTICLE.COMMENT: China is transferring some Yangtze River water to the north of the country.

X.T: In the American Southwest, the Energy Problem Is Water -- Energy producers on the Colorado River are struggling

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Sally Adee
Samuel K. Moore
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The Colorado River cannot provide enough water to all, in particular to the energy (geothermy and coal) plants.

X.T: The Water Cost of Carbon Capture -- Coal power's carbon savior could double its water woes

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Samuel K. Moore
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The current carbon capture technologies are using too much water.

X.T: How to Count ALL Human Carbon Emissions in the US

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Kevin Gurney
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A presentation of the Vulcan and Hestia projects: the first creates a US map of the CO2 emissions according to their sources, the second tries to involve anyone (using Web 2.0) to get more data.

X.T: The Business Case for Protecting the Climate

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Hunter Lovins
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A bunch of numbers. Even if I obviously agree with her ideas, this smells a little BS.

X.T: Streets 5.0 (SF Great Streets)

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Kit Hodge
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A long list of examples of temporarily or permanently modified streets so they are no more only owned by cars.

X.T: How to Drill A Relief Well -- Guiding relief wells to end the Gulf blowout requires considerable technical finesse

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: David Schneider
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The title says all.

X.T: Satellites Peer Into India's Shrinking Aquifers -- Gravity maps show disastrous draining in India's breadbasket

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Sandra Upson
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The GRACE satellites measure the groundwater depletion in India.

X.T: Save the Uranium-233, Explore Space, Save Lives

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Kirk Sorensen
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Using the current US's Uranium-233 stock in a Liquid Fluoride Thorium Reactor to produce electricity, Plutonium-238 for NASA and Technetium-99m for oncology.

X.T: Q&A With a Former Fukushima Dai-1 Plant Manager

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Eliza Strickland
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The title says all: the past experience and the current feelings of the previous manager.

X.T: Notice explicative de la carte des curiosités géologiques de la Lorraine -- Rapport final -- BRGM/RP-57546-FR -- Février 2011

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: C. Cartannaz
V. Dolliou
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A long list of geological curiosities in Lorraine.

X.T: Evolution de cavités souterraines minières : une expérimentation unique dans le bassin salifère lorrain

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Sandra Upson
ARTICLE.COMMENT: An experiment on a salt mine shows that microseismic sensors can be used to predict the cavity collapses.

X.T: Le sel à l'intérieur des terres

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Jaqueline André
Jean Baly
ARTICLE.COMMENT: An overview of the salt (ecology, geology, industry) in Lorraine.

X.T: Mine du conroy 1 hayange

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A good description of the extraction process in the years 1980's.

X.T: Mine du conroy 2 hayange

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Second part of the previous video.

X.T: aglomération Rombas.wmv

ARTICLE.COMMENT: This video describes the preparation of ore and cock before putting them in the furnace.

X.T: La montagne qui brûle

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Henri Champetier
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The burning mountain of Cransac, the underground mine of Carmaux and the open pit of Decazeville.

X.T: Poste du matin à la Houve

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Matthieu Holler
Alfred Olszak
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A working day in the last French coal mine.

X.T: La remontée de l'eau

ARTICLE.COMMENT: How to manage water after the coal mines are closed.

X.T: Paul Rothemund: The astonishing promise of DNA folding
Paul Rothemund details DNA folding

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Paul Rothemund
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Building molecular structures by folding DNA strands.

X.T: A Chinese Typewriter in Silicon Valley

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Thomas S. Mullaney
ARTICLE.COMMENT: How the Chinese typists, during cultural revolution, customized their machines by using "predictive" layouts in order to type faster.

X.T: The Coming Technological Singularity: How to Survive in the Post-Human Era
The Coming Technological Singularity: How to Survive in the Post-Human Era

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Vernor Vinge
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The Singularity: when human inventions will outperform humanity intelligence... Let's hope the Computer will core dump at that instant.

X.T: Why the future doesn't need us

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Bill Joy
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Bill Joy describes his vision of the risks induced by the new technologies (genetics, nanotechnology and robotics) and how he tries to fight them.

X.T: WIRED 8.07 Rants and Raves

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Here are the answers from some more or less known persons to Bill Joy's article.

X.T: Bill Joy: What I'm worried about, what I'm excited about
Bill Joy: What I'm worried about, what I'm excited about

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Bill Joy
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Bill Joy is still worried, but he describes here three solutions he is advocating by funding them: cheap computers used for education (but this requires the adequate software), new materials / nano-technologies, pandemic fight and biodefense. His conclusion on restricting information flow is quite doubtful.

X.T: One Half Of A Manifesto

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Jaron Lanier
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Jaron tries to demolish the Cybernetic Totalists' arguments about the future technological Armageddon. This is a kind of answer to Vinge's paper.

X.T: Douglas R. Hofstadter - Singularity Summit at Stanford

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Douglas R. Hofstadter
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Douglas Hofstadter's critic of Ray Kurzweil books.

X.T: Worlds Upon Worlds: An Illustrated Talk by Toby Lester

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Toby Lester
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The history of the Waldseemüller world map (1507), which gave America its name, and how it descends from the previous maps.

X.T: Rajesh Rao: Computing a Rosetta Stone for the Indus script
Rajesh Rao: A Rosetta Stone for the Indus script

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Rajesh Rao
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some introductory information on the Indus script which is still undeciphered.

X.T: Jean-Baptiste Michel: The mathematics of history
Jean-Baptiste Michel: The mathematics of history

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Jean-Baptiste Michel
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Trying to find some numerical rules in historical data, but this is not mathematics...

X.T: Concentration Camps

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Alan Jacobs
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A photo exhibit on Birkenau and Mauthausen, the site domain name says all that matters...

X.T: Dachau and its liberation
Dachau and its liberation

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Felix L. Sparks
ARTICLE.COMMENT: As stupid as it seems, people are fighting over who liberated the concentration camp.

X.T: Look Who's Talking

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Howard Rheingold
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Rheingold describes how the Amish are handling the new technologies, choosing to accept or not their use on a case by case basis.

X.T: Databases of the Dead

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Erik Davis
ARTICLE.COMMENT: This explains why and how the Mormons are creating the world genealogy database.

X.T: How Ant Colonies Get Things Done

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Deborah Gordon
ARTICLE.COMMENT: How simple interactions with other ants trigger a given ant to perform a task and results in the whole colony behaviour.

X.T: Joshua Klein: The amazing intelligence of crows

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Joshua Klein
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some proofs of the intelligence of crows and a machine exploiting it.

X.T: Penelope Boston: Life on Mars? Let's look in the caves
Penelope Boston: Life on Mars? Let's look in the caves

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Penelope Boston
ARTICLE.COMMENT: I wonder why humans, since they thought that a Martian civilisation has dug some channels, are so convinced that there is life on Mars despite all evidence returned by the probes we sent there.

X.T: Exploring Ocean depths and the Undersea Voyager Project.

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Scott Cassell
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The first part is about Humboldt Squid and how strange is this animal. The second part describes the Undersea Voyager Project aimed to explore the pelagic zone.

X.T: Bart Weetjens: How I taught rats to sniff out land mines
Bart Weetjens: How I taught rats to sniff out land mines

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Bart Weetjens
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Training rats to detect landmines and tuberculosis: a cheap and effective solution for Africa.

X.T: Paul Snelgrove: A census of the ocean
Paul Snelgrove: A census of the ocean

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Paul Snelgrove
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some discoveries of the ten-year Census of Marine Life, but there is still a lot to discover in the oceans.

X.T: Dinosaurs of France

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Ronan Allain
Xavier Pereda Suberbiola
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A list of the bones, eggs and footprints discovered in France.

X.T: Hadyn Parry: Re-engineering mosquitos to fight disease
Hadyn Parry: Re-engineering mosquitos to fight disease

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Hadyn Parry
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Hadyn Parry proposes to genetically modify male mosquitoes so they are sterile, then to scatter them so they met females and these ones do not lay eggs. Of course, he does not speak about the GM issues...

X.T: Something Other Than Adaptation Could Be Driving Evolution

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Brandon Keim
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Researchers have modeled the evolution of greenish warblers, a ring species, and showed that natural selection is not necessary to create new species: this would confirm the "neutral biodiversity" theory.

X.T: Paul Stamets: 6 ways mushrooms can save the world
Paul Stamets: 6 ways mushrooms can save the world

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Paul Stamets
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Using mycellium to clean up pollution, kill ants, treat smallpox...

X.T: Putting the Fun in Functional: Applying Game Mechanics to Functional Software

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Amy Jo Kim
ARTICLE.COMMENT: How to use some attributes of games (collecting, points, feedback, exchanges, and customization) to social websites.

X.T: The Pleasure Revolution: Why Games Will Lead the Way (Jesse Schell)

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Jesse Shell
ARTICLE.COMMENT: It is not so simple to gamify a product, it is a matter of pleasure: how to make them like more what they already like.

X.T: RSA Animate - The Truth About Dishonesty

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Dan Ariely
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Cheating, confession, and bankers.

X.T: RSA Animate - Drive: The surprising truth about what motivates us

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Dan Pink
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The title says all.

X.T: RSA Animate - The Paradox of Choice

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Renata Salecl
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The negative effects of having too much choices.

X.T: Debunking myths about the "Third World" (Amazing graphics)
Debunking third-world myths with the best stats you've ever seen

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Hans Rosling
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Using spectacular animated graphics to show that the world is not anymore how we believe it still is. Hans Rosling also explains that the economical data he used should be free for use by all students and professors.

X.T: When Will We Discover the Extraterrestrials?

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Seth Shostak
ARTICLE.COMMENT: After describing how we can search for extraterrestrial life, Seth Shostak gives some information about the SETI project and why it should find something in a not so far future.

X.T: Strategies in the Search for ET

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Seth Shostak
ARTICLE.COMMENT: This is more or less the same presentation of the SETI project.

X.T: Spencer Wells: Building a family tree for all humanity
Building a family tree for all humanity

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Spencer Wells
ARTICLE.COMMENT: By analysing DNA of humans all around the planet, Spencer Wells tries to find out how and when the humanity conquered the world.

X.T: Intelligence in Wikipedia

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Daniel S. Weld
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Applying IA to try to semantically understand the Web, first by starting with Wikipedia to bootstrap the learning.

X.T: Autonomous Vehicle Driving from Italy to China

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Erico Guizzo
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Experimenting partially autonomous vehicles across Europe and Asia.

X.T: How Hard Should It Be To Stop a Runaway Luxury Car?

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Robert Charette
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Are the Toyota and Lexus crashes due to floor mats or to an incorrect electronic design? It is funny to see the comments on this article: this debate is very animated.

X.T: Why Japan's Fragmented Grid Can't Cope -- Bridging Japan's east-west frequency divide to stoke power flows will require real engineering hustle

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Peter Fairley
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Palliating the loss of Fukushima reactors is made difficult by the fact that a half of the Japan is using 50Hz while the other half is using 60Hz.

X.T: Clay Shirky: Institutions vs. collaboration
Clay Shirky on institutions vs. collaboration

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Clay Shirky
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The very common idea that more and more projects succeed by collaboration rather than by administration. Despite the fact that nothing is new here, Clay Shirky's presentation is effective to describe this.

X.T: Candy Chang: Before I die I want to...
Candy Chang: Before I die I want to...

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Candy Chang
ARTICLE.COMMENT: A simple idea, suggesting people to write down what they want to do before their death, but the presentation presents few ideas and is overly sentimental.

X.T: CrowdInside: Automatic Construction of Indoor Floorplans

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Moustafa Youssef
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Data mining the traces from the phone (accelerometer, magnetometer, gyroscope, and the received WiFi signals) of many persons to build the plan of a building.

X.T: SkyLib: A Global, User-based Library for Everything

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Geir Engdahl
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The rational for creating a library of objects the neighbors can borrow, and some high level information about its implementation.

X.T: Organizing the World's Scientific Knowledge to make it Universally Accessible and Powerful

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Gully Burns
ARTICLE.COMMENT: Yet another try to organize scientific data. The fact that he does not even speak about CDISC adds to my feeling of bullshit.

X.T: L'odyssée de l'espèce

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Jacques Malaterre
ARTICLE.COMMENT: The story of men: australopithecus afarensis, australopithecus anamensis, homo habilis, homo ergaster, homo erectus, neanderthal, and homo sapiens.
